newsitem.title: JAPAN: Dollar seen mixed, mark buoyed by French election.
newsitem.headline: Dollar seen mixed, mark buoyed by French election.

text.p: The dollar is expected to be firmer against the yen and the mark to rise against the dollar in Asia on Monday after left-wing parties took an unexpectedly strong lead in the first round of French elections on Sunday.

There will be uncertainty about French politics until after the June 1 second round, but doubts over the Socialists' stance on European Monetary Union (EMU) have pushed the French franc down against the mark and lifted the mark against the dollar.
The dollar/yen could get indirect support from mark purchases against the yen, but the topside is likely to be capped at 116.50 yen on selling by Japanese exporters.
